name: How Do Insects Fly (and Why Does It Matter)?

location.name: Lecture Hall 1| National Centre for Biological Sciences
location.address: Lecture Hall 1| National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bangalore

description:
Why are insects the largest and most diverse group of animals? Is it because they can fly?

Both in terms of biomass and diversity, insects are the most successful animals from an evolutionary viewpoint. Much of this success owes to the fact that they were the first animals to evolve flight about 350-400 million years ago. This meant that they could access remote habitats and traverse greater distances than other animals. They could also evade predators, chase prey and guard territories. Insect flight occurs at extremely rapid timescales, and their fine movements are often invisible to us because they occur too fast. It is fascinating therefore to understand how the insect body and nervous system cope with the need to be both fast and precise.

Join Sanjay Sane in a lecture exploring these themes with a focus on the research in his lab.

This lecture will take place on the NCBS campus and prior registration is required.

name: Sci560 Film Festival Day 1
description:
Bengaluru, a city with many faces—garden city, military hub, industrial powerhouse, and IT capital—has blossomed into a dynamic microcosm of India. While it's now celebrated for its cutting-edge industries and thriving start-up scene, the city’s vibrant story is rooted in decades of scientific discovery, technological innovation, and cultural evolution. The Sci560 Film Festival invites you to journey through this rich history, exploring not only Bengaluru’s scientific legacy but also the diverse urban narratives that have shaped its unique identity.
With 20 films in four languages, spanning a variety of genres—from documentaries and narrative features to experimental and animated shorts—there's something for everyone. To further enrich your experience, the festival also features a range of engaging programmes, from interactive quizzes to insightful panel discussions. Join us as we celebrate the many stories that make Bengaluru the city it is today!
